thread.title: Exclusive: Shock name in the frame for the Rangers manager's job as club continue talks
thread.title_full: Exclusive: Shock name in the frame for the Rangers manager's job as club continue talks

title: Exclusive: Shock name in the frame for the Rangers manager's job as club continue talks
text:
Exclusive: Shock name in the frame for the Rangers manager's job as club continue talks ALAN IRVINE is in the frame for the Rangers managerâ€™s job. PUBLISHED: PUBLISHED: 22:30, Mon, Feb 20, 2017 GETTY Alan Irvine managed West Brom in 2014 
The former West Brom head coach is highly experienced and worked under a director of football at the Hawthorns in 2014. 
Rangers will continue the interview process in London on Tuesday as they look to appoint a director of football and new boss. 
Irvine has managed Sheffield Wednesday and Preston and worked with David Moyes at Everton . GETTY Alan Irvine is currently assistant manager to Alex Neil at Norwich 
The 58-year-old is currently assistant to Alex Neil at Norwich. 
Rangers hope to appoint a director of football first, although they are under pressure to hire a successor to Mark Warburton, with the weekend defeat at Dundee seeing them slip six points behind second-placed Aberdeen. 
The Ibrox board will sound out Frank de Boer. Others under consideration include Alex McLeish, Billy Davies, Derek McInnes, Alan Pardew and Tommy Wright. Rangers next manager odds: Who will replace Mark Warburton? Wed, February 15, 2017 Express Sport runs through the leading candidates to be the next Rangers manager, based on odds supplied by BetStars
